text: We go from birth to death. Three out of ten follow life. Three out of ten follow death. People who rush from birth to death are also three out of ten. Why is that so? Because they want to make too much of life.
author: Laozi

text: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.
author: Laozi

text: Countless words count less than the silent balance between yin and yang.
author: Laozi

text: All things carry yin and embrace yang. They reach harmony by blending with the vital breath.
author: Laozi

text: Become totally empty. Quiet the restlessness of the mind. Only then will you witness everything unfolding from emptiness.
author: Laozi

text: Why are the people rebellious? Because the rulers interfere too much. Therefore they are rebellious.
author: Laozi

text: Let things flow naturally forward in whatever way they like.
author: Laozi

text: In stillness the muddied water returns to clarity.
author: Laozi

text: The more prohibitions you have, the less virtuous people will be. The more weapons you have, the less secure people will be. The more subsidies you have, the less self reliant people will be.
author: Laozi

text: When the uncarved wood is split, its parts are put to use. When the sage is put to use, he becomes the head.
author: Laozi

text: Remember: if you can cease all restless activity, your integral nature will appear.
author: Laozi

text: Music in the soul can be heard by the universe.
author: Laozi

text: If you look to others for fulfillment, you will never be truly fulfilled.
author: Laozi

text: It is hidden but always present.
author: Laozi

text: The Way is hidden and nameless. Still only the Way nourishes and completes.
author: Laozi

text: Goodness in words creates trust, goodness in thinking creates depth, goodness in giving creates love.
author: Laozi

text: The Tao is hidden, and has no name; but it is the Tao which is skilful at imparting (to all things what they need) and making them complete.
author: Laozi

text: Embrace simplicity. Put others first. Desire little.
author: Laozi

text: Those who die without being forgotten get longevity.
author: Laozi

text: Being satisfied with little, you can gain much. Seeking much you will go astray. The wise heeds this precept.
author: Laozi

text: Whoever is capable of knowing when they have had enough will always be satisfied.
author: Laozi

text: Excellent conquerors do not engage.
author: Laozi

text: The liberation cannot be reached but by means of the perception of the identity of the individual spirit with the universal spirit.
author: Laozi

text: To rejoice in conquest is to rejoice in murder.
author: Laozi

text: The truest sayings are paradoxical.
author: Laozi

text: Clay is molded to form a cup, But it is on its non-being that the utility of the cup depends. Doors and windows are cut out to make a room, But it is on its non-being that the utility of the room depends. Therefore turn being into advantage, and turn non-being into utility.
author: Laozi

text: Clay is used to make vases, but it is the emptiness they contain that makes them useful.
author: Laozi

text: Shape clay into a vessel; It is the space within that makes it useful. Cut doors and windows for a room; It is the holes which make it useful. Therefore benefit comes from what is there; Usefulness from what is not there.
author: Laozi

text: A vessel is formed from a lump of clay with care, however, it is the empty space within the vessel that makes it useful.
author: Laozi

text: All streams flow to the sea because it is lower than they are. Humility gives it its power.
author: Laozi

text: Always be on the lookout for ways to turn a problem into an opportunity for success. Always be on the lookout for ways to nurture your dream.
author: Laozi

text: Nurture the spontaneous peaceful life.
author: Laozi

text: The fish cannot leave the deep waters. The state's weaponry should not be displayed.
author: Laozi

text: The sage has no concern for himself, but makes the concerns of others his own.
author: Laozi

text: Rushing into action, you fail. Trying to grasp things, you lose them. Forcing a project to completion, you ruin what was almost ripe.
author: Laozi

text: Attain utmost emptiness. Abide in steadfast stillness.
author: Laozi

text: When people do not dread authorities, then a greater dread descends.
author: Laozi

text: Good walking leaves no track behind it.
author: Laozi

text: Those who show off do not shine.
author: Laozi

text: The more clever and cunning people are, the stranger the events will be.
author: Laozi

text: He (the Sage) does not show off, therefore he shines.
author: Laozi

text: Sometimes gain comes from losing, and sometimes loss comes from gaining.
author: Laozi

text: When you stand with your two feet on the ground, you will always keep your balance.
author: Laozi

text: All things such as grass and trees are soft and supple in life. At their death they are withered and dry.
author: Laozi

text: An ant on the move does more than a dozing ox.
author: Laozi

text: Conclusions are ignorance arrested on the path to less ignorance.
author: Laozi

text: Stop leaving and you will arrive, Stop searching and you will see, Stop running away and you will be found.
author: Laozi

text: The good leader carries water for his people.
author: Laozi

text: Good leaders reach solutions, and then stop. They do not dare to rely on force.
author: Laozi

text: To manage your mind, know that there is nothing, and then relinquish all attachment to nothingness.
author: Laozi

text: When family ties are disturbed, devoted children arise.
author: Laozi

text: A good wanderer leaves no trace.
author: Laozi

text: Pounding an edge to sharpness will not make it last.
author: Laozi

text: Use your own light and return to the source of light. This is called practicing eternity.
author: Laozi

text: The noble must make humility his root.
author: Laozi

text: The subtlest of subtleties, this is the gateway to all mysteries.
author: Laozi

text: Peace and quiet govern the world.
author: Laozi

text: The more you know the less you understand.
author: Laozi

text: Geese are white, crows are black. No argument will change this.
author: Laozi

text: The more sharp weapons people have in a country, the bigger the disorder will be.
author: Laozi

text: The Way of the Sage is to act but not to compete.
author: Laozi

text: The Sage expects no recognition for what he does; he achieves merit but does not take it to himself; he does not wish to display his worth.
author: Laozi

text: The sage acts by doing nothing.
author: Laozi

text: The sage avoids extremity, excess, and extravagance.
author: Laozi

text: The sage governs by emptying senses and filling bellies.
author: Laozi

text: The sage's Way is to act and not to contend.
author: Laozi

text: A sage is skilled at helping people without excluding anyone.
author: Laozi

text: The sage regards things as difficult, and thereby avoids difficulty.
author: Laozi

text: The sage knows without traveling, perceives without looking, completes without acting.
author: Laozi

text: The sage never strives for greatness, and can therefore accomplish greatness.
author: Laozi

text: The sage does not attempt anything very big, and thus achieves greatness.
author: Laozi

text: The sage attends to the belly, and not to what he sees.
author: Laozi

text: The sage embraces the one, and is an example to the world.
author: Laozi

text: The sage never strives for the great, and thereby the great is achieved.
author: Laozi

text: The sage is one with the world, and lives in harmony with it.
author: Laozi

text: The sage knows himself, but does not parade. He cherishes himself, but does not praise himself.
author: Laozi

text: The sage honors his part of the settlement, but does not exact his due from others.
author: Laozi

text: The sage does not act and therefore does not fail, does not seize and therefore does not lose.
author: Laozi

text: The sage acts without taking credit. He accomplishes without dwelling on it. He does not want to display his worth.
author: Laozi

text: The sage is sharp but does not cut, pointed but does not pierce, forthright but does not offend, bright but does not dazzle.
author: Laozi

text: If the sage wants to stand above people, he must speak to them from below. If he wants to lead people, he must follow them from behind.
author: Laozi

text: The highest benevolence acts without purpose.
author: Laozi

text: When wisdom and knowledge appear, great pretense arises.
author: Laozi

text: A good door needs no lock, still it can't be opened.
author: Laozi

text: Use the light to return to clarity.
author: Laozi

text: Those who overcome others are powerful; those who overcome themselves are strong.
author: Laozi

text: To yield is to be preserved whole. . To be bent is to become straight. . To be empty is to be full. . To be worn out is to be renewed. . To have little is to possess.
author: Laozi

text: Care about what other people think and you will always be their prisoner.
author: Laozi

text: The more laws and order are made prominent, the more thieves and robbers there will be.
author: Laozi

text: Just as the value of a house lies in its location, The value of a mind lies in its depth, The value of giving lies in the presence of a generous spirit, The value of words lies in their reliability.
author: Laozi

text: The reality of the building does not consist in the roof and walls, but in the space within to be lived in.
author: Laozi

text: Open yourself to the Tao, then trust your natural responses; and everything will fall into place.
author: Laozi

text: Respond intelligently even to unintelligent treatment.
author: Laozi

text: Violence, even well intentioned, always rebounds upon oneself.
author: Laozi
